definition: to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: They arranged a farewell reception for John, who had been transferred to the head office.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲升調到總部的約翰安排了一個歡送會。

sentences.english: We're planning a farewell party for you.
sentences.chinese: 我們準備給你開一個歡送會。

sentences.english: We held a big farewell party in honor of the Olympic team of China.
sentences.chinese: 我們爲中國的奧運“軍團”舉行了一個盛大的歡送會。

sentences.english: We'll hold a farewell party for you tonight.
sentences.chinese: 今晚我們會爲您開一個歡送會。

definition: hissing sound/to hiss (as a sign of displeasure)
display of severity immediately on taking office/(fig.) initial show of strength
organizing committee/abbr. to 組委|组委
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]

pinyin: Guang3 dong1 Wai4 yu3 Wai4 mao4 Da4 xue2
